title: How to Install the Neverhood on Windows XP, Vista, 7 and 8

steps.headline: Decide how you're going to obtain the Neverhood.
steps.description: The only legal way is to purchase, inherit or miscellaneously obtain a licit copy of the Neverhood game. The Neverhood can be found anywhere from garage sales to libraries to the Internet. You can buy the Neverhood from Amazon, eBay and assorted commerce sites. This article won't cover how to get the Neverhood without paying.

steps.headline: Insert the disc that contains the Neverhood into your CD-ROM device.
steps.description: If you have an ISO file that contains the Neverhood, then right-click the ISO and select the option to open it using WinRAR or another preferred archive program. Extract all of the files to a new folder in C:\ called __neverhood. Note that the folder MUST be called "__neverhood". UNDERSCORE UNDERSCORE NEVERHOOD rather than UNDERSCORE NEVERHOOD. If you have some other kind of folder or archive that contains the contents of the Neverhood, simply extract/copy its internals (for a ZIP/tarball/whatever archive, don't copy the folder itself, copy the internals, like setup95.exe and the like) to a new folder in C:\ called Neverhood_Content.

steps.headline: Choose one of two methods to proceed.
steps.description: Now, you got two options: either use ScummVM to play the game (under a variety of platforms, such as Windows, Mac OS or Linux), or use the original game installer and executable, together with the Neverhood Restoration Project's installer.

steps.headline: Go to the project's homepage.
steps.description: You need to download a daily build of ScummVM, as the latest stable version (1.6.0) does not support the Neverhood yet.

steps.headline: Copy the contents of your Neverhood CD in a folder of your hard drive.
steps.description: You don't need the game's original installer.

steps.headline: Start ScummVM and click on the "Add Game" button
Point ScummVM to the folder where you copied the game's files.
steps.description: A new game entry called "The Neverhood" should appear.

steps.headline: Go ahead and play.
steps.description: You're good to go! Just select "The Neverhood" from the list of games, and either double click on the entry, or single click on it and press "Start" to play the game. If you're still stuck, you can read ScummVM's user manual

text: Steps Decide how you're going to obtain the Neverhood. The only legal way is to purchase, inherit or miscellaneously obtain a licit copy of the Neverhood game. The Neverhood can be found anywhere from garage sales to libraries to the Internet. You can buy the Neverhood from Amazon, eBay and assorted commerce sites. This article won't cover how to get the Neverhood without paying. Insert the disc that contains the Neverhood into your CD-ROM device. If you have an ISO file that contains the Neverhood, then right-click the ISO and select the option to open it using WinRAR or another preferred archive program. Extract all of the files to a new folder in C:\ called __neverhood. Note that the folder MUST be called "__neverhood". UNDERSCORE UNDERSCORE NEVERHOOD rather than UNDERSCORE NEVERHOOD. If you have some other kind of folder or archive that contains the contents of the Neverhood, simply extract/copy its internals (for a ZIP/tarball/whatever archive, don't copy the folder itself, copy the internals, like setup95.exe and the like) to a new folder in C:\ called Neverhood_Content. Choose one of two methods to proceed. Now, you got two options: either use ScummVM to play the game (under a variety of platforms, such as Windows, Mac OS or Linux), or use the original game installer and executable, together with the Neverhood Restoration Project's installer. Using ScummVM Go to the project's homepage. You need to download a daily build of ScummVM, as the latest stable version (1.6.0) does not support the Neverhood yet. Copy the contents of your Neverhood CD in a folder of your hard drive. You don't need the game's original installer. Start ScummVM and click on the "Add Game" button  Point ScummVM to the folder where you copied the game's files. A new game entry called "The Neverhood" should appear. Go ahead and play. You're good to go! Just select "The Neverhood" from the list of games, and either double click on the entry, or single click on it and press "Start" to play the game. If you're still stuck, you can read ScummVM's user manual
